metadata.title: CVE-2012-6580 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Best Practical Solutions RT 3.8.x before 3.8.15 and 4.0.x before 4.0.8,when GnuPG is enabled, does not ensure that the UI labels unencryptedmessages as unencrypted, which might make it easier for remote attackers tospoof details of a message's origin or interfere with encryption-policyauditing via an e-mail message to a queue's address.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6580` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.0.13-1
rt4-apache2 - 4.0.13-1
rt4-clients - 4.0.13-1
rt4-db-mysql - 4.0.13-1
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.0.13-1
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.0.13-1
rt4-fcgi - 4.0.13-1
rt4-standalone - 4.0.13-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.13-1').
